name: places/ChIJK6UXXoBZwokRzYuzWQlR7cg
formattedAddress: 171 Delancey St, New York, NY 10002, USA
adrFormatAddress: 171 Delancey St, New York, NY 10002, USA

originalText.text: Dr. James Johnson at NYU should not be conducting foot surgeries, he’s a podiatrist who’s unskilled as a surgeon. What started off as a routine bunionectomy 3 years ago, has left me maimed after 5 of his “corrective” surgeries. My first metatarsal was done wrong, which caused a chain reaction to my second and third. Instead of correcting the original issue, he proceeded to hack away at my other toes, which are now rendered mostly unusable. I’ve had an additional 5 surgeries with two orthopedic surgeons who’ve tried to fix the mistakes of Dr. Johnson. Sadly, after a total of TEN procedures, I’m still left somewhat crippled and the quality of my life will forever be changed. People, be sure to see an “orthopedic surgeon” not a “podiatrist” for surgeries. I will say, as a person, he is very kind and compassionate with good intentions.
